title.narrative: Indonesia: Scholarships Prog. for Strengthening Reforming Institutions

description.narrative: The Development Objective of the proposed project is to build participating agencies capacity by (a) strengthening their humanresources in core functional areas; and (b) enhancing their ability to initiate and manage reforms.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Article IV Section 4.01 (a) of the Loan Agreement | Description :(a) The Project Operations Manual has beenadopted by the Borrower in accordance with the provisions of Section I.D.1 (a) of Schedule 2 of the LA.(b) The NationalDevelopment Planning Agency Project Implementation Unit and the Ministry of Finance Project Implementation Unit have beenestablished by the Borrower in accordance with the provisions of Section I.A.9 and I.A.11 of Schedule 2 of the LA | Due Date:15-Jun-2011

Finance Agreement :Section I | Description :The Borrower shall appoint, no later than twelve (12) months after effective date,appoint, in accordance with the provisions of Section III of this Schedule, consulting or other firms through the NationalDevelopment Planning Agency PIU for purposes of implementation of each of Parts 3 (a) (i) and (ii) and (b) (iii) – implementationof scholarship programs, provision support of PCU and PIU to pro | Due Date :15-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Section I | Description :The Borrower shall, no later than twelve (12) months after the Effectiveness Date,appoint, in accordance with the provisions of Section III of this Schedule, a consulting or other firm through the ProjectCoordination Unit for purposes of Part 3 (b) (i) – annualtechnical audits on eligibility, selections and implementations - of theProject | Due Date :15-Jun-2012

Finance Agreement :Section I | Description :The Borrower shall: furnish to the Bank for approval as soon as available, but in anycase not later than November 30 of each year,the annual work plan and budget for the Project for each subsequent year of Projectimplementation, of such scope and detail as theBank shall have reasonably requested, except for the annual workplan and budget forthe Project for the first year of Project implementa | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section II | Description :The Borrower shall have its Financial Statements audited in accordance with theprovisions of Section 5.09 (b) of the General Conditions. Each audit shall cover the period of one (1) fiscal year of the Borrower.The audited Financial Statements for each such period shall be furnished to the Bank not later than six (6) months after the end ofsuch period | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section II | Description :The Borrower shall monitor and evaluate the progress of the Project and prepareProject Reports in accordance with the provisions of Section 5.08 of the General Conditions and on the basis of the indicators setforth below in sub-paragraph (b) of this paragraph. Each project report shall cover the period of one (1) calendar year, and shallbe furnished to the Bank not later than three (3) months a | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section II | Description :The Borrower shall review jointly with the Bank, no later than one (1) month after thesubmission of each Project Report to the Bank, such report and thereafter take all measures required to ensure the efficientcompletion of the Project and the achievement of the objective thereof, based on the conclusions and recommendations of such reportand the Bank’s views on the matter. | Due Date :31-Jul-2012

Finance Agreement :Section II | Description :Without limitation on the provisions of Part A of this Section, the Borrower shallprepare and furnish to the Bank, not later than forty five (45) days after the end of each calendar quarter, interim unauditedfinancial reports for the Project covering the quarter, in form and substance satisfactory to the Borrower and the Bank | Frequency:Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Section IV | Description :The Borrower shall, no later than one (1) year after the Effective Date, adopt,through each of the Participating Agencies, scholarre-entry policies, in form and substance satisfactory to the Borrower and theBank, for purposes of the scholar re-entry and careerdevelopment program to be developed and implemented under Part 3 (b) (iii) ofthe Project. | Due Date :15-Jun-2012

title.narrative: Percentage of respondents in the agency expressing satisfaction with the impact of the program on building agency capacity
Increase in percentage of staff with the relevant competencies in the core priority areas of the participating agency, as based on needs and gap analysis
Program evaluation: Percentage of scholars expressing satisfaction with the program based on staff survey
Successful completion of training: Percentage of scholars completing their programs of study with GPA>3.0 (annual targets)
Technical competencies and gap analysis conducted

target.value: HCDPs as authorized documents that are regarly updated and used as a basis for all training irrespective of financing source

actual.value: 22 HCDPs authorized and are being updated regularly through AWPs

title.narrative: Effective scholar reintegration: Re-entry, placement, and career development policies in place

actual.value: Re-Entry policies developed and partially formalized
